column1: description
MR FU COMPLAINED THAT HE WAS WAITING FOR HIS MEAL TOO LONG
Zero quantity of Angostora Bitters loaded in any of the JC bars or containers.
Zaid was  seated beside females
Yuko worked as CSV on this flight
Yuko worked as CSV on this flight
Yukari operated as the GR1 as we were short of one J class crew.
Yubi  forgot to bring her waist coat for the flight . She discovered that she didn't have it  while on the bus to the aircraft

YP was taken care of by crew member Greenbee Greenbee and Stephanie were looking after her in flight.  YP was encouraged to drink a lot of water and was observed sleeping most of the time during the flight.  She had her meal on every service and was monitored at all times.
YP special handling.

YP requested alcoholic beverages.  During  boarding Urgan requested to have a glass of champagne.  After take off and during the meal services he constantly asked for cocktails which contains alcohol such as mojitos, bloody mary and cosmopolitan.  Urgan had for dinner fish and mango and raspberry torte.

YP Mr Iason Crist 32GMr Crist was escorted to the aircraft by ground staff Boilueti 163323.He was seated next to: Chrysoula Artemis Gomez, 32F.He ate and drank: chicken for both meals.Crew member responsible: Dorde Kockarevic 453822.Upon arrival in EWR he was met by: Leslie 415166

YP / UMNR Feedback                          Mr.Addellah Jaberraslane was the 1st customer to board the aircraft and was received by myself . Customer was bought by the ground agent in IAD and paperwork had been prepared by Arthur # 2177497.
YP  no documentsMiss Sourpi arrived unescorted and carried her own documents.As she was seated next to a man we swapped the seats around so that Miss Sourpi was now sitting next to a lady.

YP   Prompt to motion sicknessI was informed by EK HKG staff that YP Boxi mother requested us give his child a tablet of motion sickness as he is prompt to motion sickness.YP was find and has no motion sickness on this flight.Attn PURPlease take note and give one tablet of Stugeron during boarding.
Young traveller along with his brother came as UM with the ground staff.Ground staff handed their passport to the purser.The mother of the children was seated on 52 H.

Young Passenger ManagementLuke was looked after by crew member Jordan, he had an orange juice to drink and continental breakfast. No male customer was sat next to him.For the lunch service Luke had the chicken meal.

Young Passenger ManagementEmily was looked after by crew member Jordan, she had an orange juice to drink and continental breakfast. No male customer was sat next to her.Emily had chicken for the lunch service.

Young Passenger ManagementAaron was looked after by crew member Jordan, he had an orange juice to drink and continental breakfast. No male customer was sat next to him.Aaron had the chicken for his lunch.
YOUNG CUSTOMER During the flight the customer had a chicken with tomato sauce and accompanied with potato and other vegetable. She also drink tea with milk and apple juice.
YOGURT missing on the trays For breakfast service yogurt was missing in all trays. Menu states that we should have yogurt on the breakfast tray.
Yogurt missing from breakfast trays.  During breakfast service, crew informed me that approximately eight trays were missing the yogurt.
Yogurt consistency  Customer complaint that the yogurt(on breakfast tray) is watery and residues built up underneath. Yogurt brand: Zottis yogurtCustomer info: yolly airoldi@hispeed.ch

Yogini displayed very good team sprit on this journey.We had no customers in first class and she participated in all the services in economy class.Her colleagues were appreciative of her support to the team.

YOGHURT NOT LOADED ON BREAKFAST TRAYSPlease be informed that yoghurt was not loaded on EY meal trays for the breakfast service.Yoghurt is featured in the EY menu. 2 customers had inquired and crew explained that it is not loaded and apologised.
Yoghurt not available on the tray as per the menu.
Yoan Saves,451642,worked as a GR1 for both sectors

YC MISSING PILLOWS AT HYD  Once on ground at HYD, after customers disembarkation, we noticed that some pillows were missing from variousYC seats.  Most probably they were taken by individual customers at the outbound sector.  Few extra pillows were available.   After a quick inspection, seats affected were 33B, 43A, 44A, 44E, 50A.

YC Customer Did Online Upgrade  During boarding customer informed that he paid 836euros for two upgrade seats to JC cabin  Customer showed an email confirming that they are both confirmed in JC seats  Ground staff informed them that it does not show in their system  Customer informed that his credited card has been deducted for the payment  Done by CSV Patrice limpoco   392082 (KIS System Error with Name)Mr. Bruno Rota Email: rotabrunow@yahoo.ittel no. +393771036131Address: Via Matalone No. 9 24060 San Paolo D'Argon Bergaulo, Italy

YC Customer Did Online Upgrade  During boarding customer informed that he paid 836 euros for two upgrade seats to JC cabin  Customer showed an email confirming that they are both confirmed in JC seats  Ground staff informed them that it does not show in their system  Customer informed that his credited card has been deducted for the payment  Done by CSV Patrice limpoco   392082 (KIS System Error with Name)Mr. Bruno Rota Email: rotabrunow@yahoo.ittel no. +393771036131Address: Via Matalone No. 9 24060 San Paolo D'Argon Bergaulo, Italy
YC boarding from the L1 door.  There were several YC Customers that boarded from the L1 door .
YC BLANKETS  COVERBlanket covers in YC were too big and messy
YC AFT Galley   The Aft galley safety and security searches were performed by R2A CSV Josymol s398610 to assist L5, since we did not have L5A

Yasmina Faden yaksic staff number 453557 operating Duty free cart number 1004 on 29th January 2018, WAW DXB sector forgot to put two duty free items inside the cart anther sealing all DF carts and containers. items number:EK  D2105 &EKD2105. As I didn t know how to proceed I kept them with my own to wait for further instructions. Thanks

Y/CLASS MENU/SERVICE CHANGE DUE TO CPH STATION CATERING ISSUES As per flight instructions for this trip, menus were not to be loaded due to service change and cancellation of breakfast service. This is due to catering issues In CPH and requirement to carry return catering from DXB, hence breakfast service is cancelled. However, menus still mention breakfast service availability. It was found that menus were still loaded for the flight. Menus stipulated availability of breakfast service despite only lunch service being available.
Y/C Towel service suspended.Due to turbulence towel service has to be suspended before landing.

Y/C smoke coming from oven in MID galley   After take off it was reported by GR2 MID galley operator that smoke is coming from oven No2 (M711)  After thorough investigation it was discovered that traces of burned food inside the oven base caused smoke to appear  Oven was not used for the duration of the flight

Y/C refuse to sit down while seat belt sign was on.Customer Mr Harrison Chinwuko seated on 42C was angry as his son needs to use the toilet while the seat belt sign was on due to turbulence and crew was seated, customer physically took his son to the toilet.
Y/C Paid seat customer Customer Mr Enola Fadairo seated on 24K asked crew for more spacious seat as he is an over sized customer.
Y/C IFE issue.Customer Mrs Geraldine Okpara seated on 36F had her IFE not working during the meal service.
Y/C IFE INOPCustomer Mrs Manon goosens seated on 50K had her IFE not working for the flight.

Y/C GOLD SKYWARDS CUSTOMER ASKED FOR J/C PRODUCT Mr. shubbar asked for a small bottle of water saying, "I always get it in all of my flights, and I want it today as well." He was also behaving strange towards me. When I was talking to another gold skywards member, he came and asked me, "May I have your permission to pass through?"
Y/C Customer vomited.Customer Mrs Hendricks East seated on 60G vomited on herself after the main meal.Customer claimed she vommitted after eating her dinner.
Y/C Customer unhappy with cabin temperature.Customer Ms Emanuel Gatto seated on 50H claimed after main meal service that the cabin is cold.

Y/C customer unhappy Due to plate meal service.Customer informed crew Eleanor # 400950 during meal service that why its taking too long for him to get his meals.Due to turbulence Captain advised crew to be seated for 40min after take off.
Y/C customer smoking e cigarette.Customer Ms Karolinaanna Kuzma seated on 33K was observed by crew member Andreea # 417545 while delivering we care service after the main meal service.

Y/C Customer playing music.Customer Mr and Mrs Shiner seated on 60AB was drinking and playing uno on board and during meal service customer started playing music loudly on the cell phone.Customers on 59DE informed crew that the music is loud.
Y/C customer moved seats.Customer moved to 19DEFG as 27G was occupied once the KIS was fully synchronized.

Y/C customer informed Cabin Supervisor that the Amarula Cream had expired.Code on bottle reads: 11 1 17 EAll remaining bottles in Y/C and J/C checked. Same code on all bottles except one bottle, which read: 1 11 17 C
Y/C customer had liquid dripping from hat rack.During taxing customer Ms Theodore Okonkwo seated on 44J claimed that some liquid dripping from hat rack.
Y/C Customer claimed he was upgraded.Customer boarded the aircraft and seated on 11A claiming that he had upgraded online and waiting for on board WiFi to confirm his email.
Y/C Customer cancelled SPML. Customer Mr Danny Jadid seated on 48G claimed that he wanted to change to menu choice during meal service.

Y/C Champagne glass spillage.During pre departure service crew member Mena # 427260 was clearing the glasses and walking back to the aft, aircraft turned at the same time and a champagne glass fell on the tray and spilled champagne on to Mr Rashid Elbetar's right upper arm.

Y/C CATERING FEEDBACK  Before landing, I asked Mr. Denisse if he had any feedback for the company or anything he would like to see different.  Mr. Denisse stated that over the past couple years, the Y/C appetiser on the tray has gradually become "less luxurious" (e.g. no more salmon and potato salad), and more and more "bird seed" (e.g. quinoa and barley).  The appetisers have become "very poor" in his words.  He stated that some "salmon or chicken" would be nice.
Y/C  Customer request for personal WCHR at the door.During disembarkation at DXB customer Mr Josephus Verbraekan seated on 68K asked for his WCHR.
Y/C   SPML request.Please uplift AVML for customer for her on ward connection.
Y/C   PVS screen not responsive.Customer Mr Renato Vezzoli seated on 24K had his IFE touch screen not working.

Y/C   HVC like to have chocolate. Customer Mr Ahmed Abdalla seated on 21K came to aft galley for chocolate bar after main meal service and asked crew member Aleksandra # 451834. Customer approached myself and claimed crew doesn't want to give chocolate to him.  Customer Mr Ahmaed Abdall stated to crew member Aleksanra that she can give the dessert to some other customer's while he was walking away from the galley.
Y/C   Ginger ale on high demand.High demand for ginger ale. Please uplift more or these sectors.

Y/C   Customer Vomited.  Customer Ms Mahnoor Tariq seated on 63G claimed that she vomited four times before the flight as she ate lamb on her previous sector.  Customer claimed she vomited at the airport four times and twice on board.
Y/C   Customer request declined.Customer Mrs Strefania Pellitteri seated on 41B requested for coffee during top of descend to crew member Ying #450098

Y/C   Customer need to wait for his requested drink.Customer Mr Andrea Angelo De Felice seated on 78G requested for a glass of mango juice to crew member Kanyawe # 452834 just prior to top of descend.Customer insisted to have Mango juice.
Y/C   Cake provided from MXP Customer Mr Augusto Lotorto seated on 17C was provided with a cake by MXP catering.  No special request on KIS/PIL for cake.
Y.c disembarking from f.c  L1 door . we landed about 25 minutes late into Bangkok and parked at remote bay.

Y J UPGRADE UCCCF form was used to manually upgrade Mr. Agruq from 18H (Y/C) to 09F (J/C) KIS tablet did not display the skywards profile for the customer, therefore this upgrade could not be processed on the KIS.  PIL showed that customer had a balance of 721839 miles.  PIL showed that customer required 19500 miles for the Y J upgrade. Skywards details:  Mr. Nedal Amin Yousif                               Skywards# EK106044540                               Expiry: 02/2018 Ticket # 176 2312396174 1
Y J Cash Upgrade Not showing as skywards member, Mr Mermit paid cash.
Y class seats During cruise Mr. Ings informed me that the seats in Y class cabin were not comfortable and we should make the leg room bigger.
Y CLASS CREW MEAL 6 BEING PUMPKING RAVIOLI  Y class crew complained that 6/8 crew meals were pumpkin ravioli

Xylolin ML1 FAK was opened for Xylolin however it was found empty The purser was informed I called the captain to ask for permission to open the 2nd FAK at ML2. Captain approved, Xylolin was given to customer  MIRF and logbook entryways filled out
xxx

XIAOFENG XU 422088+ While completing her DF paperwork on returning to DXB, Xiaofeng noticed that she was missing 1 signed credit card receipt from a sale on the outbound sector+ Sale amount was 225 Dhs
Wrong word translated from English to Russian on the menu.Side dish selection had beans option or in Russian it was written peas.
Wrong wine menus  wrong menus were offered to customers as they were mixed with a MAN menu bag found on board.

Wrong SPML provided.  The customer was provided with a VLML tray and desert but the Hot meal was NLML.  The provided NLML was a chicken breast served with rice.  Due to the customers dietary requirements she could not eat it and crew member offered a crew hot meal (pumpkin ravioli).  No complaints was received from the customer.

Wrong Spelling of Cocktail in Business class menu and in Cocktail guideThe French classic cocktail in both menus is spelled "Kir Royale" which is incorrect. We French spell it "Kir Royal" the correct spelling is without a "e".All of the items involved in this cocktail are "masculine" (champagne, cocktail are both masculine), the actual spelling is feminine which implies that the cocktail is as well.

Wrong Special Meal Provided. Crew member Elena has accidentally given the husband's (travelling companion)special meal order which was HNML. The couple had switched seats. Mrs Parikh has taken 1 bite of the chicken and sent it back. The customer was extremely upset with crew member Elena and asked for her to remove it immediately. She did not want to speak to her anymore.

Wrong sector menus distributed:  During the initial meal service, it was highlighted that the Customers were offered menus of the return sector (HKG/DXB).  This was observed only from rows 41 to 68.( fwd. section of the YC cabin ).
WRONG SEAL TYPED IN THE HHC DF 1194  Elena Rata operator GR1 during opening of the DF cart she introduce the closing seals in the HHC 7500797146 7500797147 7500797148
Wrong metal seals used on one container of DF537 and one container of DF538.2 seals were mistakenly swapped during the sealing and logging off process.
Wrong menus  crew has accidentally distributed EZE GIG menus for pre departure.  I only realised after take off.
WRONG MENU TERM Meal is described as "BARBECUE BEEF SHORT RIBS" but the beef looks more of a steak than ribs. Customer was unhappy stating that menu was misleading.
Wrong Meals Percentage Announced By Catering for Return sectorThe catering had informed us that the percentage for both meal choices was fifty percent however it was less than seventy/thirty percent.

Wrong meal choice During breakfast service, cabin crew Aldo noticed 5 meals that weren't from the menu. Breakfast menu options were omelette and scrambled eggs, and one oven insert was full of chicken.
Wrong loading of canape. Menu says hummus with lamb Baharat but we were loaded with hummus only and rice balls instead
Wrong item on the menu   CanapŽOne of the items according to the menu was Smoked salmon crepe parmentier however in fact it was pate served on pumpernickel bread.

Wrong information in duty free magazine:  Items number 2112 8 and 2111 8, description in the duty free magazine has wrong information.  Item's discretion in Arabic says 32 megabyte, and in English says 32 gigabytes.
WRONG HOT MEAL RECEIVED  Ms Yasui complained that she received the breakfast casserole instead of the lunch hot meal during the lunch service.

Wrong flight opening final  Flight Open was closed with wrong Pax load numbers.  The actual load was full 14 76 427  The load as per KIS 10 44 366  The same wrong numbers was on all KIS tablets (mine + 3CSVs)
Wrong final figure
Wrong email address   please send confirmation  upon updating his mew email.address
Wrong Duty free seal placed on cart Duty free Cart Number 445 Metalic seal placed on cart and containers resulting in Duty free not being able to be done on return leg by next crew

WRONG DUTY FREE OPENING SEALS, AND DESTINATION  When I opened the HHC it showed me wrong opening seals and was showing wrong flight number 0035 DXB NCL./ instead of 0654 DXB  CMB I informed my CSV and the Purser and closed the duty free with the closing seals.  when I closed the duty free it was showing me different seal numbers instead of the ones I was supposed to put.I put the seals I had in the HHC pouch.
Wrong dessert catered Dessert on the menu for this sector was chocolate tart.Dessert actually catered was an Arabic cream pastry (same  as the DXB KWI sector)

Wrong cart used for service  the galley operator in mid galley sent by mistake 1lunch cart on each side of the cabin instead of breakfast cart (1st service was breakfast) and all tray were given out to customers .

WRITTEN VR ON SIN BNE SECTOR SHOWED WRONG FLIGHT SECTOR  After the receiving the copy of the written VRs on SIN BNE sector through e mail, I've noticed that all the VRs raised on this sector showed the wrong flight sector, which is BNE SIN.  Customers' profiles and seat numbers were correct, only showed the wrong sector.

WRITTEN VR ON DXB SIN SECTOR SHOWED WRONG FLIGHT SECTOR  After the receiving the copy of the written VRs on DXB SIN sector through e mail, I've noticed that all the VRs raised on this sector showed the wrong flight sector, which is BNE SIN.  Customers' profiles and seat numbers were correct, only showed the wrong sector.

Wrist injuryAbout 20 minutes to top of descent, we hit sudden unexpected moderate turbulence. At that moment crew Rana Helou (staff 459027) was walking through the cabin at mr4 area next to the galley, she then fell against the wall and onto the floor hurting her right hand wrist. The wrist was visibly inflamed and movement was limited. Due to this injury Rana had to be deadheaded on the sector back to Dubai as advice by medical hotline.Witness: Jose Braun (410056) and Maria Cruz (450931)MIRF number 334961Crew accident report: 73728

WOW CUSTOMER                                                                           MRS Kenny is a nervous flyer, she told FG1, KHALIZA(S395636). Khaliza tried so many different ways to calm her down, giving lots of attention to her and her husband. On top of descent, MRS Kenny came to F/C galley, wanted to talk to crew, Khaliza.  She was hugging the crew,Khaliza and thanking her for an amazing flight, extra attention to her  and her husband. she mentioned that her husband is a terminated cancer patient and she was super happy, it seems like they ticked the bucket list. she was teary. I offered her polaroid photo to this couple and crew together on their suits, I wished them  full of happiness and we were very happy to be part of their amazing trip.  On disembarkation, they mentioned again, they had a fantastic day.

would like to highlight the performance of my team on this flight .Crew members in economy were all brilliant.Crew members were very happy, smiley always and working hard without me asking them.We had issues with the luggage on those sectors and the purser requested from economy crew to be very efficient to make sure all customers are seated to close the doors, and the crew worked so hard to make customers sit down with all the bags secured in the hatrack.Crew were helping each other without hearing that's my side or that's your side.Crew were always preparing things in the galley without me tempting them.The other CSV Ramya gave feedback as well that they are all amazing.

Would like to compliment all economy crew members for their hard work , showed good team spirit through out the trip.Challenges which they encounter were,Turbulence,Handle Medical case. EK Standards were met . On a full cabin.All above challenges were not only encounter with utmost professionalism despite the fact of one crew short in economy.
